analyzed: theḥ apadāna  eka pad umiya vagga
translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Ekapundarika

analyzed: dha ja dāya kattheḥ a padāna
translated: The Elder Dhajadāyaka’s Birth Story
“The Teacher named Tisso,
the world’s chief, the best of men,
having seen the end of the three attachments,
I raised up a flag.
Because of that good deed,
and because of my intention and aspiration,
having given up my human body,
I went to the Tāvatiṃsa heaven.🔽Three times I was a god-king

analyzed: deva rajjam akārayi  satānam pañcakkhattum ca  cakkavattī ahosaha
translated: among the Thirty-Three,🔽and five times I was a wheel-turning monarch.
I have experienced extensive local kingship
beyond counting,
because of my own deeds,
well done in the past.
Twenty-two eons ago,
the deed I did then:
I do not know of any bad destination,
this is the fruit of giving a flag.

analyzed: icchamānaḥ caham ajja  sa kānanam sa pabbata
translated: And if I wanted to today,🔽I could cover with grass
the whole of Khomadussa,
the fruit of what I did then.
The four analytical knowledges …
… and the Buddha’s instruction has been carried out.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā dhajadāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā dhajadāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: Thus has the venerable Dhajadāyaka told this verse.
The Story of the Elder Dhajadāyaka is finished.
